Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Roger Smith <rog_21@y...> wrote:
>  
>
>>I would not mind trying to set this up.
>>I will have to find a host that we can use.
>>I will prob use something similiar to webdav if that
>>is ok with all of you.
>>
>>    
>>
>
>Cool...let me know if you end up setting anything up!
>This could be good for promoting NE research.
>  
>
Indeed.

Roger, have you had any thoughts on how to arrange the site? I think it 
should be kept reasonably simple, unless you want to go the whole hog so 
to speak :)  So for starters I would just use plain HTML and have a page 
of short descriptions for each of the domains, perhaps categorised by 
implementation language. Then perhaps a more detailed page of 
documentation and stuff per domain..

I'm not sure how you will arrange file uploads. You may just want to 
give out an email or ftp address that people can upload to and then you 
can add the files to the site manually. Or were you thinking of 
something more dynamic, maybe allowing people to create there own area 
on the web page and upload the file(s) and descriptions/documentation?  
This is more work and is going to require a server with support for 
something like ASP. Now, there are free web servers that allow ASP but 
when I last looked at this (a year ago) they were all ad-ware servers, 
which I personally dislike.

If you do get ASP support then another option is support for forums. I 
recently set up some forums using a load of free ASP scripts and a 
single MS-Access database and it's actually very simple. By far the most 
difficult stage was deciding which forum implementation to use :)

I will perhaps scour the internet for suitable (and free) web servers 
when I get chance. Probably at the weekend.

Colin.
